Deficiency Narrative:
Operation did not report within two hours to licensing timely when four residents ran from the operation. The residents were under age 13.
Incident report indicates the residents ran at 4:45 pm and reported to hot line at 9:02 pm.
Correction Narrative: In the future Hill Country Youth Ranch will report serious incidents to residential child care licensing within two hours of notifying law enforcement. Staff involved in the incident have been counseled regarding the time-frames for reporting.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the incident report it was found that the names of all adults involved, their role in relation to the child and the circumstances surrounding the incident were not documented.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided the following Compliance Plan via email: In order to assure serious incidents are documented in a written report that provides all of the information and details in accordance with minimum standards the form in Extended Reach is being assessed and training will be done for all staff charged with writing serious incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was not immediately taken to be evaluated by medical professionals following an assault by two peers. The Incident Report noted the caregiver finding "pooled blood" on the floor of the room where the assault took place, and the child sustained a knot on their head, a bloody nose, as well as bruising. Due to injuries and severity of assault, the child should have been evaluated for a concussion and broken bones.
Correction Narrative: In person follow up conducted at operation. Two staff members were interviewed and verified first aid training as well as a review of policies and procedures pertaining to medical care.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers did not provide a level of supervision necessary to ensure a child's safety and to intervene when a child was assaulted in the annex of the cabin away from the main house..
Correction Narrative: In person follow up conducted. Two staff members were interviewed and confirmed review of supervision policies and procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers did not report to their administrative staff a serious incident in which a child was assaulted by two other children in care.  In addition, the caregivers allowed a child in care to go to the annex and be in the presence of other children who had assaulted them two days prior. In a separate incident, a volunteer/frequent visitor to the operation aggressively approached and verbally assaulted a child in care at an outside location.
Correction Narrative:
Compliance Plan was provided by the operation via email on 8/21/2024.
The plan noted staff involved will be given training in reportable serious incidents and discussions will be held with staff and administrative staff regarding interaction between residents following conflict. Administrative staff spoke with a person (visitor) who was reported to have approached a child from the Ranch in an aggressive manner regarding the inappropriateness of the approach and she has committed to exercise better self-regulation in the future when dealing with Ranch children.

Deficiency Narrative: Incident Reports contained conflicting date and time reporting. An incident report for the assault of a child selected "Yes" to the question "Was child taken to medical professional," but the next response noted the child "will be medically examined tomorrow." Additionally, an Incident Report labeled "type" as Verbal Aggression when the child was the victim of an assault by peers. In other Incident Reports, the type of incident includes that the child is the victim.
Correction Narrative: A Compliance Plan was provided via email from the operation on 8/21/2024. The plan noted all staff involved in this incident will receive remedial training in record keeping in order to maintains true and accurate records so that information correctly notes when an incident took place, specific details, the nature of the incident, and so childrens records remains up to date.

Deficiency Narrative: A report of abuse, neglect and/or exploitation of a child in care was not made following an incident of a child being pulled off of a couch, having their pants pulled down, and an inappropriate image was drawn on their face. Images of the child's face were shared with peers and staff before an intervention was made.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided Compliance Plan via email. Operation reported Staff present at the time of the incident will be given training in reportable serious incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed by the operation that a staff member fell asleep while providing supervision to children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response. Operation states that staff that are found to be sleeping during nighttime hours will be subject to suspension or termination or additional training will be provided. Operation program directors will monitor video surveillance to ensure that night staff are awake. Cabins are called randomly two times per night and unannounced cabin checks are also completed at least one time per months. These calls and unannounced checks are documented. Corrections have been made at the operation as the incident occurred in January 2024. Staff was provided additional trainings and put on a corrective action plan.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide the Annual Summary Log of Unauthorized Absences after it was requested.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response on 01/08/2024. Operation states that they will begin to log information regarding unauthorized absences including name, age, gender and date of admission of child who eloped. They are currently working on having the information generated through the Extended Reach system but in the meantime, they will manually log the required information.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have abuse and neglect policy available for review.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a response stating that they  already had policies in place regarding preventing, recognizing and responding to abuse. They recognize, however, that these policies were not codified into a singular document. The operation provided an updated policy for preventing, recognizing and responding to abuse and neglect of children which meets standard 748.121.

Deficiency Narrative: During walkthrough for Cannon House, Van 33 a seatbelt was found cut, unable to use by a child in care. In addition, a van was found with open rips at the time of inspection and this van was being utilized for transportation purposes of children in care.
Correction Narrative: During in person inspection van related to citation is not in use. Work orders were provided at the time of inspection and van is currently in repair. Documents and compliance plan were received through email.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that the operation did not complete documentation of medication errors within 24 hours.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced walkthrough was completed of the cabin with citations, 2 binders were reviewed and found to be completed per the standard. Medication information was documented in its entirety.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that service plans for children receiving treatment services for emotional disorders were not updated within 90 days.
Correction Narrative: The service plan of a child in care receiving treatment services was reviewed and found to be in compliance with the standard. The required documentation was also noted during the review.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that a staff member failed to demonstrate prudent judgement when they exchanged personal text messages with a child in care.
Correction Narrative: In response to the case findings, the operation has taken actions to address staff concerns. The steps being taken by the operation were discussed with the administrator during inspection #3937841. Additionally, an email was received from the operation on 04/13/2023 regarding their compliance plan. The operation has increased monitoring of cameras in all cabins. Operation is reviewing and updating their policies regarding staff engagement with children and youth on social media. The operation recognizes the importance of maintaining safe and appropriate relationship with children and will review these polices with all employees.

Deficiency Narrative: A child sustained injury that required medical attention and incident was not called in until months after.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a follow-up regarding the deficient standard stating that effective immediately all non-scheduled routine medical visits will be reported to Licensing within 24 hours. The operation will be requesting an administrative review.

Deficiency Narrative: Food in a freezer was found to be open.
Correction Narrative: Food in a freezer was found to be open.

Deficiency Narrative: Two toilets were observed with no toilet paper.
Correction Narrative: Two toilets were observed with no toilet paper.

Deficiency Narrative: Two ovens and one sink  were observed to be dirty.
Correction Narrative: Two ovens and one sink  were observed to be dirty.

Deficiency Narrative: Food in a refridgerator was found to be expired.
Two refrigerators, a dishwasher, two ovens, one sink, and two bathrooms  were observed to be dirty or not in good repair.
Yearly updated documentation showing inspections are unavailable at the operation has not been provided.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a response to the citation stating that they continue to have difficulties getting a health inspection completed at their operation. They are outside the city limits and the county does not provide this service. The operation states that they are able to conduct quarterly inhouse inspections using TDFPS form 2932: Environmental Checklist until an alternative can be found.

Deficiency Narrative: Three fire extinguishers observed have not been inspected since April 2022.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a corrective action plan in response to the citation. Operation states that the staff member responsible for inspecting the fire extinguishers on a monthly basis understands that this must be completed by the last Friday of every month. The executive director of the operation will assign a designee to ensure that this is completed.

Deficiency Narrative: A plate of fish was observed left out on the kitchen counter at cannon cottage.  A dish of meat and noodles was obsevered uncovered in the refrigerator and food was observed on the floor in the pantry at meadow cottage.  An open containter of raw meat was observed in the refrigerator at mabee cottage.
A medical incident involving a child that did not rise to the level of a serious incident was not documented in the same manner as a serious incident report.
Correction Narrative: A compliance plan was received from the operation. In response to the standards deficiency the operation stated that a staffing was completed with staff regarding the deficiency and the circumstances in which a serious incident report needs to be documented.

Deficiency Narrative: A restraint was used on a child in care during a situation which was not considered an emergency.
Correction Narrative: Operation responded with a corrective action plan stating that the staff member that restrained the child is no longer employed at the operation. The operation will continue to receive training on proper EBI techniques and procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were yelled at by a caregiver.
Correction Narrative: The operation responded with a corrective action plan by stating that the staff member that yelled at children completed additional compassion fatigue training on 03/10/2022. Supervision of direct care staff and children by supervisors will continue in order to ensure safety and wellbeing of children.

Deficiency Narrative: A volunteer did not have all the required trainings to be a caregiver for children and supervised 8 residents with a staff.
Correction Narrative: The operation will ensure that volunteers or contractors who perform employee functions meet the required qualifications, by being careful not to mix RTC and Basic Care participants in activities unless necessary. If it is necessary to mix RTC and Basic Care Program kids together in an activity, the operation will ensure that qualified supervision ratio will be present by discussing beforehand the necessary qualified staff that will be needed to meet the ratio requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member provided children in care with vaporizer pens on multiple occasions.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response stating that the staff member was immediately terminated and vacated the premises. Program Supervisors will continue to perform unannounced visits and monitor the cabins daily. All staff receive training regarding Professional Boundaries and other trauma focused childcare training. Ratio was increased in the boy's cabin to provide additional supervision for the children.

Deficiency Narrative: Three staff members were made aware of allegations of abuse toward children in care, yet failed to report as per timeframes.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response stating that additional risk and reporting training was completed with all staff. The operation is also contracting with an external agency to conduct an organization risk assessment to review policies and procedures. Program Supervisors will continue to perform unannounced visits and monitor the cabins daily.

Deficiency Narrative: Evidence and information gathered support that a staff member inappropriately touched, provided substances to and inadequately supervised children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation will be implementing a night electronic check system to enhance supervision during sleep hours. Camera systems will be installed in common areas to ensure residents safety. Program Supervisors will monitor and review. The operation will be conducting a policy and procedure review. New hires and new volunteers will undergo additional safety screening.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff allowed two children in care to transport other children in care, who are not licensed drivers.
Correction Narrative: The staff member that allowed the children to drive the vehicle was fired. Direct care staff will continue to be required to complete transportation training. Residents are not allowed to drive vehicles.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member employed by the operation provided illegal substances to children while charged with caring for them. A staff member was made aware of these allegations of abuse against a staff member and failed to act in protecting children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response stating that the employee named in the incident had their employment terminated and does not have access to children in care. Direct care staff received risk management training to include reporting and serious incidents. Program Supervisors will continue to perform unannounced visits and monitor the cabins daily. A new night electronic monitoring system will be implemented by January 31, 2022. The operation is exploring prevention training opportunities with other partners in addition to the training we currently offer.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member admitted to smoking in the children's living quarters.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response stating that the staff member was immediately terminated and vacated the premises. Program Supervisors will continue to perform unannounced visits and monitor the cabins daily. All staff receive training regarding Professional Boundaries and other trauma focused childcare training. Ratio was increased in the boy's cabin to provide additional supervision for the children.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member was inappropriate with children and provided illegal substances to minors.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance response stating that the employee named in the incident had their employment terminated and does not have access to children in care. The operation will continue to monitor and supervise children daily. The operation will continue to evaluate supervision practices and monitor staff compliance of  Personnel Policies and Procedures and HHSC Minimum Standards. Disciplinary action, up to termination may result if staff are found in noncompliance. A new night electronic monitoring system will be implemented by January 31, 2022. The operation is also contracting with an external agency to conduct an organization risk assessment to review policies and procedures. Ratio has been increased in the boy's cabin to provide additional supervision by staff. Mentor visits are no longer allowed to take place in private and must be held in a communal area.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not provide adequate oversight and a caregiver provided children with illegal substances, alcoholic beverages and acted inappropriately with children while employed at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a corrective action plan stating that in response to the deficiency they terminated the staff member's employment. The operation will be installing a electronic check system to improve supervision. Camera systems will also be installed in common areas of the homes and program supervisors will review footage.

Deficiency Narrative: Medications were observed in a child's bedroom.
Correction Narrative: Direct care staff will continue with annual medications policy and procedures training. The medical coordinator will complete random and unannounced inspections.

Deficiency Narrative: Throughout the operation there were a total of 7 missing thermometers in the refridgerators.
Operation did not report awareness of communicable disease timely.
Correction Narrative:
Compliance plan received from Executive Director via email.

Operation will ensure that a report is made to licensing within twenty-four hours along with notifying the child's guardian of all children in care who contract a reportable communicable disease.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was made aware of concerns of an inappropriate relationship between a child in care and a staff member and failed to take action to protect the child. The child in care was sexually abused by the staff member.
Correction Narrative: Issues brought to the attention of HCYR were addressed by the Program Director. HCYR will ensure that any issues and/or concerns are appropriately addressed and noted in the personnel file. HCYR will continue to evaluate supervision practices and monitor staff compliance of HCYR Personnel Policies and Procedures and HHSC Minimum Standards. Disciplinary action, up to termination may result if staff are found in noncompliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was sexually abused by a staff member.
Correction Narrative: The employee named in the alleged incident was terminated immediately and does not have access to children in care. HCYR Supervisors will continue to monitor and supervise children daily.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not report to Licensing concerns of an inappropriate relationship between a child in care and a staff member for possible sexual abuse.
Correction Narrative: HCYR will continue to abide by Serious Incident Report timelines as defined by HHSC Minimum Licensing Standards.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care engaged in sexual behaviors due to neglectful supervision of a staff member.
Correction Narrative:
On 09/13/21, email was received from operation with the following compliance plan:

Upon receiving the report regarding the two youth involved, the employee responsible for supervising the resident was terminated. HCYR ensures that all employees are adequately trained and understand their job responsibilities. In this incident, the employees lapse in judgment and failure to report the incident were cause for termination.

HCYR will continue to provide support, training, and supervision to ensure children are appropriately monitored.

Staff has been terminated and no longer present at this operation.
